line_1: Which time or anguish never shall efface,
line_2: And in its stead his barbed dart shall place.

line_1: But horrors, which e'en madness can't efface.
line_2: My tortur'd mem'ry cannot it retrace;

line_1: Which time or sickness never can efface.
line_2: The honour of a long illustrious race;

line_1: Must ruthless Time's rude touch efface
And would the goodness of the soul efface,
line_2: To substitute dishonour in her place.

line_1: But time did my sorrows efface,
line_2: None ever bemoan'd my sad case;

line_1: Which cherish'd, hopeless, will your charms efface,
line_2: And rob your features of each blooming grace.

line_1: To find out schemes successful to efface
line_2: Great Heber's name, and crush the sacred race;
Stamp thy Image in its Place,

line_1: Join in one stock, which time shall ne'er efface.

line_1: Whose nameless charms the Dorian claims efface,
The energy of Pope they might efface,
line_2: Ah! could they catch his strength, his easy grace,

line_1: As Time, I said, may happily efface
line_2: That cruel Image of the King's Disgrace;
